statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -4 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ -13 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -4 \\ -6 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ -13 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
